item.name: Customer Profile
item.description: These endpoints provide the features for store admins to create and manage customers' details.

description.content:
Using this endpoint, you can add a new customer to the system. The response includes an `id` which is required in subsequent calls, such as `GET /customers/{customerId}`, `PUT /customers/{customerId}`, `PATCH /customers/{customerId}`, and more.
When `externalId` is specified, the customers have teh ability to manage their own details through storefront UI.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: The request is received but an internal error occurred

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

Use this endpoint to get a paginated list of customers.
By specifying the query parameters `offset` and `limit`, you can narrow down the search results. You can also `sort` the results in an ascending or descending order. Additionally, with the `isDeleted` query parameter, you can filter for either deleted or non-deleted customers. When no query parameter is specified, by default, you get up to 10 records.
The number of records to skip before returning records. For example, when offset is 20 and limit is 10, this endpoint returns records from 21 to 30.
The maximum number of records in a single page.

The criteria to sort results, where `-` indicates a descending order and `+` indicates an ascending order. You can apply sorting to the following fields - `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, `firstName`, `lastName`, `emailAddress`, and `status`.
A flag indicating whether only the deleted customers need to be included. Set to `true` to include only the deleted customers and `false` to exclude deleted customers.
The number of records to skip before returning records. For example, when offset is 20 and limit is 10, this endpoint returns records from 21 to 30.
The maximum number of records in a single page.

The criteria to sort results, where `-` indicates a descending order and `+` indicates an ascending order. You can apply sorting to the following fields - `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, `firstName`, `lastName`, `emailAddress`, and `status`.
A flag indicating whether only the deleted customers need to be included. Set to `true` to include only the deleted customers and `false` to exclude deleted customers.

Using this endpoint, you can get details of a single customer by `customerId`.
(Required) A 24-character system-generated ID of the customer. This is returned in the response of the `POST /customers` endpoint.

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

Using this endpoint, you can update details of an existing customer by `customerId`.
This endpoint replaces the existing details of the customer. If you want to make only a partial update, without replacing the entire details, use the `PATCH /customers/{customerId}` endpoint.
(Required) A 24-character system-generated ID of the customer. This is returned in the response of the `POST /customers` endpoint.

(Required) A 24-character system-generated ID of the customer. This is returned in the response of the `POST /customers` endpoint.

item.name: Customer Address
item.description: These endpoints provide the features for store admins to create and manage customers' addresses.

description.content: Using this endpoint, you can add a new address for the customer by `customerId`.
(Required) A 24-character system-generated ID of the customer. This is returned in the response of the `POST /customers` endpoint.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

Using this endpoint, you can get all addresses of a customer.
By specifying the query parameters `offset` and `limit`, you can narrow down the search results. You can also `sort` the results in an ascending or descending order. Additionally, with the `isDeleted` query parameter, you can filter for either deleted or non-deleted customers. When no query parameter is specified, by default, you get up to 10 records.
The number of records to skip before returning records. For example, when offset is 20 and limit is 10, this endpoint returns records from 21 to 30.
The maximum number of records per page.
The criteria to sort results, where `-` indicates a descending order and `+` indicates an ascending order. You can sort the following fields - `updatedAt`, `country`, `city`, and `region`.

A flag indicating whether only the deleted addresses must be included in the response. Set to `true` to include only the deleted addresses of the customers and `false` to exclude the deleted addresses.
(Required) A 24-character system-generated ID of the customer. This is returned in the response of the `POST /customers` endpoint.
The number of records to skip before returning records. For example, when offset is 20 and limit is 10, this endpoint returns records from 21 to 30.
The maximum number of records per page.
The criteria to sort results, where `-` indicates a descending order and `+` indicates an ascending order. You can sort the following fields - `updatedAt`, `country`, `city`, and `region`.

A flag indicating whether only the deleted addresses must be included in the response. Set to `true` to include only the deleted addresses of the customers and `false` to exclude the deleted addresses.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
The number of records to skip before returning records. For example, when offset is 20 and limit is 10, this endpoint returns records from 21 to 30.
The maximum number of records per page.
The criteria to sort results, where `-` indicates a descending order and `+` indicates an ascending order. You can sort the following fields - `updatedAt`, `country`, `city`, and `region`.

A flag indicating whether only the deleted addresses must be included in the response. Set to `true` to include only the deleted addresses of the customers and `false` to exclude the deleted addresses.

Using this endpoint, you can get a single address of a customer based on the `customerId` and `addressId`.
(Required) A 24-character system-generated ID of the customer. This is returned in the response of the `POST /customers` endpoint.
(Required) A 24-character system-generated ID of the customer's address.

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

Using this endpoint, you can update a customer's address based on the `customerId` and `addressId`. This replaces the existing address with the new one. If you want to make only a partial update, use the `PATCH /customers/{customerId}/customer-address/{addressId}` endpoint.
(Required) A 24-character system-generated ID of the customer. This is returned in the response of the `POST /customers` endpoint.
(Required) A 24-character system-generated ID of the customer's address.

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

With this endpoint, you can search for customer's addresses based on the specified filter conditions. In addition, you can tailor the search results by including or excluding the deleted addresses and the default addresses.
**Note**:A customer can have a default address for both billing and shipping.
(Required) A 24-character system-generated ID of the customer. This is returned in the response of the `POST /customers` endpoint.

item.name: Customer Self
item.description: These endpoints provide the feature for customers or shoppers to independently manage their details in the storefront.

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

The fabric **Customers** API is used to create and manage details of storefront customers, also referred to as shoppers. The `Customers` or `Customer Address` APIs provide features for store admins to manage their customers' details and addresses. The `Customer Self' API provide features for customers or shoppers to independently manage their own details.

Contact Support:
 Name: fabric Support
 Email: support@fabric.inc
